title: Teen in critical condition after shooting on city's west side
content:
Autoplay:Teen critical after shooting on city's west sideCONNECTING...
INDIANAPOLIS -- A teenager is in critical condition after being shot on the city's west side Friday evening.
Police were called to Port Lillian Drive around 7:30 p.m.
The 16-year-old victim was playing soccer with his younger nephew in a field in the center of the apartment complex, according to police.
They say two men approached the boys from a nearby wooded area and after exchanging some words with the 16-year-old they shot him once in the abdomen.
Police believe a pair of shoes may have something to do with the shooting.
The victim was taken to the hospital where they died but were medically revived according to police. That person is currently in critical condition. Their identity has not been released.
#IMPDNOW: UPDATE-Officers were just advised that the person shot in the 5700 blk of Port Lillian Dr has been medically revived but critical
— IMPD (@IMPD_News) November 5, 2016
Police do not have any suspects at this time.
#UPDATE: Shooting victim, teenager, remains extremely critical at hospital. Investigators work to develop leads but robbery may be motive
— IMPD (@IMPD_News) November 5, 2016
The shooting remains under investigation by the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department.
